intro: Stillingia salpingadenia var. cupulifera, commonly known as the cupular stillingia, is a rare variant of the Stillingia genus native to specific regions of China. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring elongated, tube-like petals that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and moderate climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
